{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's age, the location of the lesion, and the description of the lesion with raised, pearly borders and telangiectasias are all characteristic of basal cell carcinoma. Squamous cell carcinoma often presents as a scaly, erythematous, and indurated lesion, which does not match the description given. Actinic keratosis is a precancerous skin condition characterized by scaly, crusty spots on the skin, which also does not match the description. The option 'Was' does not make sense in this context.", "answer_choice": "A"}
